name: hullabaloo
content:

a loud noise made by people who are angry or annoyed; a lot of angry comments made in public about someone or something: make a hullabaloo There's a crowd of angry demonstrators making a real hullabaloo outside the Houses of Parliament. Synonyms
anarchy

mayhem
pandemonium
ruckus mainly US informal
rumpus informal
to-do informal
tumult formal
turmoil
uproar
public disapproval or complaints: The minister resigned after all the hullabaloo over his affair with an actress.

a loud noise made by people, often because they are angry, or a situation in which many people are angry or upset: They finally stopped production of the play because of all the hullabaloo it caused.
